15818.name: ToAtem
15818.description: Atem Switcher にPNGを送るプラグイン

23403.name: Add Border
23403.description:
This plugin adds a Rectangle node as a border.

I hope Figma implements one sided border in the future but please use this plugin until that day.

21293.name: @sposhe/reorder
21293.description:
Reorder a frame's children by their X or Y position (from right to left, top to bottom, etc).


To use:


  1. Select one or more frames with child nodes.
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Select a direction and press "Reorder"

19593.name: StuDocreator
19593.description:
A small text generator for books, courses and documents.


To generate this text, simply have text fields selected and click on whichever data you want to generate.


Example: If you want to generate a Document Title, select a text field and click on the 'Title' button under the 'Documents' section.

If you want to generate a Book Author, select a text field and click on the 'Author' button under the 'Books' section.


If you would like to generate all the data of a section, for example the Title, Course and Institution of a Document, you need to have three text fields selected each named appropriately. The fields should be named by section and type, so section_type


Example. Select 3 text fields named

  1. document_title
  2. document_course
  3. document_institution

And click on the Document button in the Documents tab. This will generate all information into these text fields.

19127.name: Wantedly Preflight
19127.description:
Wantedly Preflight is a Figma plugin that validates your project satisfies the rules of the design system of Wantedly.


Features

  •  Validation ― You can check whether the node is valid just by running the plugin. The result will come out with a detailed message and you can jump into fixing it immediately with a focus button.
  •  Configurable ― Wantedly Preflight has 6+ sophisticated rule and all of them are well-tested. However, in case if you would like to opt-out of some of the rule in your project, you can independently configure items to enable.
  •  Ignore ― Exceptions are always there. On the result page, you have a check button to ignore the specific node. After you ignored a node, it will always be considered appropriate regardless of whether it violates our rules or not.


Our Design System

See Wantedly UI Components

22824.name: Knob Creator
22824.description:
Welcome to Figma Knob Creator


Knob Creator is a Figma plugin to create knob stack images. These can be used for creating themes for digital audio workstations, VST plugins and more. The aim of this plugin is to make this as easy as possible.


Go to the Howto Page page for an explanation on how to use this plugin.


Contribute


If you would like to contribute, you can do it by:


  • Fork the repo, add your code and create a PR
  • Buy me a coffee


Issues


Did you run into issues, or have any feature requests? Add them here.

23850.name: Copy names for Json
23850.description: One click copy file names, and you can choose the suffix!

23580.name: Outline to Single Stroke
23580.description:
How To Use (Tutorial file )

  1. Select a filled vector on canvas
  2. ⌘/ ⌨️ outline to single stroke
  3. Press ⌨️ Tab⇥ and enter the line weight of your vector
  4. Press ⌨️ ↩︎ to run plugin (if the line weight is omitted the plugin will try to infer an approximation, but sometimes this can be far from accurate)


🚨 The plugin will not work on vector shapes with varying line weight, nor on vectors that doesn't have fill applied


💡 ⌥⌘P to quickly execute again with the line weight you entered last time

23441.name: Lilt Figma Connector
23441.description:
Lilt allows you to experiment, iterate, and optimize designs for your customers around the world:

  • Iteratively test design spacing, layout, and format across languages
  • Design a UX that accommodates (and optimizes for!) multiple languages
  • Build a smooth user experience, no matter your customer locale


What is Lilt?

Lilt is the modern language services and technology provider. We provide end-to-end, fully managed translation services for enterprise organizations worldwide.

Lilt combines world-class professional translators, an all-star service team, and adaptive neural machine translation technology to give organizations everything they need to scale their content localization, go-to-market faster than ever, and improve the global customer experience. For more information about working with Lilt, please reach out to sales@lilt.com.



How does the Lilt Figma plugin work?

The Lilt Figma plugin makes it easy to design great customer experiences across any language, right from within Figma. The Lilt Figma plugin offers a dual translation approach, offering the user the flexibility to experiment, iterate, and finalize designs that have been optimized for multiple languages.

Users can choose Instant Translation, in which translated content is populated from a custom machine translation engine, or Verified Translation, in which content is translated by a human translator with the assistance of the Lilt Platform.


The Lilt Figma plugin enables you to:

  1. Design in your base language.
  2. Test your design by language with Instant Translate.
  3. Iterate with Instant Translate until satisfied.
  4. Send your design for Verified Translation when you have finalized your design.


Key features and functionality include:

Choosing your preferred translation method

Sending Figma files to Lilt for localization

Applying translation memories for each locale

Receiving completed translations directly in your Figma instance


For rapid iteration, Instant Translation provides a machine translated version of your design right in Figma within seconds. Once design has been finalized, Verified Translations sends your designs to Lilt, where human linguists translate, review, and approve your newly localized designs before sending them back to your Figma instance.


An overview video of the Lilt Figma plugin can be seen here.


How to launch this plugin:

Launch the plugin:

  1. Open your Figma account.
  2. Go to the Plugins section and choose Lilt.
  3. In Figma, launch the Lilt plugin and navigate to Settings.
  4. Enter your Lilt API key
  5. Enter the Lilt API URL
  6. Click "Save Settings" to conclude the setup process.


When the setup is complete, start using the plugin by pushing your Figma strings to the Lokalise project so translators can start working on them right away.


For more information, visit the Lilt knowledgebase here.


To use this plugin, your company must be a Lilt customer.

23189.name: Tally
23189.description:
Quickly tally stamp votes for stickys!


Select everything you want to tally up (including the stickys and stamps) and run the plugin. It will add a visual tally count to the bottom right of every sticky for everyone to see.


Notes:

  • Don't worry if the selection contains other types of components, they won't affect the tally. Just drag a big rectangle selection over the entire area and let Tally handle the rest!
  • You will need to re-select and run the plugin every time new stamps are added that you want to include in the count
  • Stamps do not need to be directly on a sticky for them to be counted. If a stamp is part of the selection, it will count towards the sticky that it's closest to

23775.name: POEditor
23775.description:
What is POEditor?


POEditor is a highly scalable online translation platform and localization management system, designed to bring together developers, product managers, translators, designers and copywriters in their effort of making multilingual software, and to automate the localization workflow.


Trusted by companies like Bosch, Adidas and Ubisoft, POEditor brings transparency to the localization process, boosting productivity and collaboration between product, design and localization teams and helping avoid possible localization bugs.


For more information on the POEditor platform, please visit: https://poeditor.com/


How Figma and POEditor work together


To connect Figma to a POEditor account, enter the API key of that POEditor account in the Figma plugin.


You’ll be able to create new projects on that account using the plugin, or work with projects which already exist in POEditor.


The POEditor plugin for Figma works both ways, so you can send texts from Figma files to POEditor translation projects and fetch translations from POEditor to Figma.


In POEditor, multiple translation options are available: 

  • assigning your own translators to specific languages, by adding them as contributors
  • crowdsourcing translations from your community, using public projects
  • ordering human translation services from integrated language service providers
  • using machine translation APIs from DeepL, Google or Bing

23124.name: Unlock All Layers
23124.description:
Simply unlocks all layers on a page with 1 click. Displays how many it unlocked when complete.


Repo

Texture in cover

23473.name: Grid System
23473.description:
No more searching for the right grid to match your frame size!!!

 

Functions to simplify your grids problems:

 

✅ Save grid templates with min and max sizes.


✅ Apply auto grids to frames -the plugin detects the frame’s sizes and applies the right grid that you saved as a template.


✅ Show all grids in selected frames with one click.


✅ Hide all grids in selected frames with one click.


✅ Delete and update templates.

23846.name: Arrange page order
23846.description: Arranges the page to the specified number

23303.name: Pages
23303.description:
Functions to simplify your pages problems:


✅ Select and delete multiple pages or choose to delete all of the pages in a file.

✅ Add multiple pages in one go.

✅ Save pages templates.

✅ Create pages index in a click.


✳️ If you want to create a separator page e.g -------------  just type “-” as a page name.

And if you want to add a separator with a name e.g ----cover---- just type “-cover-” as a page name.

check


for example:

-cover-,page 1,page 2,-,page 3 =>


✔ ---------cover---------

   page 1

   page 2

   ------------------

   page 3
